description: Latin curtatus, past participle of curtare (“to shorten”).

adjectives.description: curtate (comparative more curtate, superlative most curtate)

entries.meaning: (astronomy) said of the distance of a planet from the sun or earth, as measured in the plane of the ecliptic, or the distance from the sun or earth to that point where a perpendicular, let fall from the planet upon the plane of the ecliptic, meets the ecliptic
